body:
This PR introduces a rules file called `.markdownlint.yml`, related developer tools and documentation, and a sizeable amount of documentation formatting from applying these rules.

`.markdownlint.yml` can be used by running npm package `markdownlint` from the repo root. In this case, I ran:

```
markdownlint . --ignore "doc/release-notes*" --ignore "doc/release-notes/*" --ignore "src/leveldb/*" --ignore "src/leveldb/**/*" --ignore "src/univalue/*" --ignore "src/univalue/**/*" --ignore "src/secp256k1/*" --ignore "src/secp256k1/**/*" --ignore "src/crypto/**/*"
```

A few advantages come from adding this linter / developer tool:

- Consistent formatting and improved readability, both rendered and as plaintext. New developers will be discouraged to nitpick documentation once rules are established.

- `.markdownlint.yml` automatically offers warnings in VSCode if plugin `markdownlint` installed.

- This linter could be added to Travis CI, failing if it generates any output. If `npm` is a concerning dependency, `markdownlint` could be repackaged as a standalone binary via [zeit/pkg](https://github.com/zeit/pkg).

- With a few tweaks, markdownlint could be eventually used to lint Doxygen comments too. 

- Note: The `Table of Contents` should be at a top level above both `Developer Notes` and `Development Guidelines`, but is inside the first, `Developer Notes`. This inconsistency is manually ignored for now.
